alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 3:16PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Burleson, southern Grimes, southeastern Brazos, northeastern Washington and northwestern Waller Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Washington, or 11 miles northeast of Brenham, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern College Station, Navasota, Washington, Millican, Anderson and Independence. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
